info.title: Exposure API Reference
info.description:
![RedBee](https://redbee-fsly-vod.cdn.redbee.live/imagescaler002/redbee/redbeetv/configimages/d04bb721-fb45-4f9e-9216-9c3a219ef322.png?format=webp&h=50)

### Red Bee Media Pulse Exposure API 

#### Authentication

Many endpoints require an `Authorization` header:

`Authorization: Bearer <sessionToken> `

In the **Swagger UI**,  use the **green Authorize** function below to set the session token.

The `<sessionToken>` is acquired using one of the Login or Session creation endpoints in the [Authentication](#/Authentication) resource section.

In some endpoints an API-key is required in the `EMP-Auth` header.

`EMP-Auth: Basic <keyId:keySecret>` 

`<keyId:keySecret>` is to be Base64Encoded

API keys can be created using the customer portal: [https://redbee.live/portal](https://redbee.live/portal).

Older API keys can also be used in the same way as previous.

#### Data formats

Request and response bodies are always JSON encoded.

In request and response bodies, dates and times are ISO 8601 encoded, e.g. `2022-02-22T22:22:22+00:00`, while in query parameters epoch millis are used.

#### Customer and Business Unit

Most endpoints requires `customer` and `businessUnit` in the path. You can instantiate this documentation for a specific customer and businessUnit using this8 URL:

[https://exposure.api.redbee.live/docs/customer/{customer}/businessunit/{businessUnit}/](https://exposure.api.redbee.live/docs/customer/{customer}/businessunit/{businessUnit}/)

#### Eventsink

The endpoints to report Player analytics events are found here: [https://eventsink.api.redbee.live/docs](https://eventsink.api.redbee.live/docs).

#### Other documentation   

General information of the service can be found at [https://redbee.live/docs/](https://redbee.live/docs/).

tags.name: playback devices
tags.description:
Manage playback devices.
Devices are added automatically when you do a play-call on a given device
until the configured device limit is reached.
If no device limit is configured no devices will ever be added.
Device limits can be configured per OU, account plan or individual account with the latter overriding the former.

Get a thumbnail for an asset.
get.description: The thumbnail will be generated from the video belonging to the asset and based on  provided time.  This endpoint will always return a 307 redirect to another url where the thumbnail is actually available.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: The time to use when creating the thumbnail. It can have two different formats. It can be a wall clock time like '2021-02-02T10:53:35.400Z'. This assumes that the asset has a wall clock time. It can also be a duration, like PT30M20S, and then it will be used as an actual time in th video.

Invalid duration.description: The provided time is not a valid duration.

Invalid wall time clock time.description: The provided time is not a valid wall clock time.

get.description: Main endpoint for listing/searching for assets. Make sure that calls to this endpoint are called with a limited set of parameter permutations to allow responses to be served from a cache.

parameters.name: assetType
parameters.description: Any value of this parameter will be ignored if 'assetTypes' is also used.

parameters.name: assetTypes
parameters.description: The parameter 'assetType' will be ignored when this parameter has values.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The optional query to filter by. In the elasticsearch query string query format, I.E: "tagsIds:action AND localized.en-us.title:armageddon"

parameters.name: parentalRatings
parameters.description: The parental rating filter in the format of COUNTRY:RATING,COUNTRY:RATING2

parameters.name: includeFields
parameters.description: Comma separated list of field names to include in response.

parameters.name: excludeFields
parameters.description: Comma separated list of field names to exclude from response.

Result window too large.description: Result window too large. The pageSize * pageNumber was larger than the max. Usually the product of the two cannot be larger than 20000.

get.description: Status of a channel includes whether it is available (in the case of virtual channels) and the currently playing assets. This endpoint only considers active channels.

parameters.name: minutesForward
parameters.description: Include future assets that start sooner than this many minutes ahead. Default value 0 returns only the currently playing asset of each channel

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: Page number. Currently only supports one page

parameters.name: sortingLocale
parameters.description: Sort by the sorting title property of the given locale

404.description:
Not found:
UNKNOWN_BUSINESS_UNIT - If the business unit is not found.
CHANNEL_STATUS_NOT_FOUND - Channel is personalized or the channel type could not be found.

get.summary: Gets the status of a specific channel

parameters.name: minutesForward
parameters.description: Include future assets that start sooner than this many minutes ahead. Default value 0 returns only the currently playing asset of each channel

404.description:
Not found:

CHANNEL_STATUS_NOT_FOUND - Channel is personalized or the channel type could not be found.

post.summary: Register license renewed for a downloaded asset
post.description: Register that a downloaded asset's license has been renewed.

post.summary: Register a completed download of an asset
post.description: Register that a download of an asset has been completed.

get.description: Retrieve XMLTV EPG data for a specific channel with optional parameters.

parameters.name: daysBackward
parameters.description: The number of days backward to retrieve EPG data

parameters.name: daysForward
parameters.description: The number of days forward to retrieve EPG data

get.description: If the entitlement checks pass it will return the information needed to initialize the player.

parameters.name: assetId
parameters.description: The id of the asset to play

parameters.name: X-Adobe-Primetime-MediaToken
parameters.description: Adobe primetime short-lived media token. Used for verification against Adobe Primetime

parameters.name: persistent
parameters.description: To be used if we can deliver both persistent and non-persistent licenses for one business unit

parameters.name: timeShift
parameters.description: Use this if we can deliver a time shift for smooth. DO NOT USE unless you are told so.

parameters.name: live
parameters.description: Use this if you really want to play live and do not care about the EPG even if one exists. DO NOT USE unless you are told so.

parameters.name: maxResolution
parameters.description: Use this to filter out higher bitrates. Note that this requires backend configuration for your organization.

parameters.name: audioOnly
parameters.description: Use this with value true if you only want to include audio tracks in the response.

parameters.name: maxFrameRate
parameters.description: Use this if you want to include only video tracks with a max frame rate.

parameters.name: forwardedFor
parameters.description: Provides the end user IP if there is a proxy in between.

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: Use this to provide a start time when playing a channel. Should be used when there is no EPG available. Format: ISO_DATE_TIME example 2021-01-31T00:00:00Z. Experimental, do not use unless told so.

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description: Use this to provide an end time when playing a channel. Should be used when there is no EPG available. Format: ISO_DATE_TIME example 2021-01-31T00:00:00Z. Experimental, do not use unless told so.

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description: Provide GPS-based geo-location for location-based ad targeting (optional) e.g. latitude=33.543682. Used for SSAI.

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description: Provide GPS-based geo-location for location-based ad targeting (optional) e.g. longitude=-86.779633. Used for SSAI.

parameters.name: consent
parameters.description: A consent string passed from various Consent Management Platforms (CMPs). Used for SSAI.

parameters.name: deviceMake
parameters.description: Manufacturer of device such as Apple or Samsung. Used for SSAI.

parameters.name: gdprOptin
parameters.description: DEPRECATED: gdpr is now set automatically. A flag for European Union traffic consenting to advertising. Used for SSAI.

parameters.name: mute
parameters.description: Indicate whether the player is muted or not. Used for SSAI.

parameters.name: ifa
parameters.description: User device ID. Used for SSAI.

parameters.name: appStoreUrl
parameters.description: App store URL. Used for SSAI.

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: Channel Partner. Domain where player is embedded. Used for SSAI.

parameters.name: ccpaConsent
parameters.description: A flag for US consent for advertising. Used for SSAI.

parameters.name: supportedFormats
parameters.description: A comma-separated priority list for supported formats for playback, first value has the highest priority. Supported values are hls, dash, mss, mp3, aac. First value will always be used for SSAI.

parameters.name: supportedDrms
parameters.description: A comma-separated list for supported DRM providers for playback. Supported values are widevine, fairplay, playready.

parameters.name: limitAdTracking
parameters.description: True if the user opted-out of ad tracking. Used for SSAI.

parameters.name: materialProfile
parameters.description: Provide material profile if you want to play a version used for a specific purpose. You need to know what profile to use.

parameters.name: custom
parameters.description: A comma-separated list for sending additional custom non-SDK supported SSAI parameters. Used for SSAI.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Start time in the number of seconds in the playback manifest.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: End time in the number of seconds in the playback manifest.

get.description: Entitle the user to access the asset
Initiate the download of an asset for offline play.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: The time to be used when checking entitlement

get.summary: Get account products for a given organization unit
get.description: Returns two lists: 'entitled' and 'notEntitled' products for a given organization unit. The 'entitled' list contains products the account has access to, while the 'notEntitled' list contains products the account has no access to.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: The time to be used when checking entitlement.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization header in the format 'Bearer sessionToken'

get.description: List all devices where playback is currently allowed for the logged in account
Get all the information about a single device for the logged in account

delete.description: Remove a device from the list of allowed devices for the logged in account

get.description: Retrieve AdRoll configuration for a specific business unit.

get.summary: Get MRSS for a specific business unit
get.description: Retrieve MRSS for a specific business unit with optional parameters.
Retrieve MRSS for a customer with optional parameters.
[OpenApi 3](https://www.openapis.org/) specification of this API

password.description: The user's new, or first password. Must follow the system's configured policy.

informationCollectionConsentGivenNow.description: If true consent to information collection is given now. If false or null no consent given now.

grants.description: List of application specified grants, the grants has no semantics in the backend. These grants will be returned if the PIN is successfully verified.

items.description: List of application specified grants, the grants has no semantics in the backend. These grants will be returned if the PIN is successfully verified.

modified.description: When was the pin last modified.

newPassword.description: The user's new password. Must follow the system's configured policy.

logoutOnAllDevices.description: If true the user, including any of the account's profiles, will be logged out from all devices.

deviceId.description: A unique ID of this device, used for logins from the device.

name.description: The user's name of the device

crmToken.description: The token of the underlying CRM to use if talking directly to the CRM.

sessionToken.description: The (bearer) session token to use in subsequent requests.

isOverDeviceLimit.description: If true to many devices are logged in and this session can not be used to play. Normally this will not happen.

type.description: boolean:  value range null/undefined, false, true, email: valid email address, string: any string, integer: integer number e.g 1, real: Real/decimal number e.g 1.1, enum: a value defined by enums.

requiredAtSignup.description: If true the user must provide a value, whicgh mayt be the default value.

value.description: The value set by the user.

enums.description: If type = "enum": The enums value set.

valueSet.description: If true the attribute has been set, potentially with a null/undefined value, in which case the default value is used.

id.description: Used as value of the enum.

ApiUserAttributesEnumValue.description: If type = "enum": The enums value set.

ApiUserAttributesRange.description: if type = "integer" or "real" and any range is specified: min and max values.

profileType.description: Application defined value. Can be used e.g. to carry mapping to parental rating configuration.

additionalProperties.description: Application defined map String->String. Can be used for arbitrary application specific data

metadata.description: Application defined map String->String. Can be used for arbitrary application specific data

active.description: True if this user profile is the active user (the user fetching this info.

owner.description: True if user is owner of the account.

emailAddressRequired.description: True if the user must have an email address. Check User attribute primary-email-address instead.

language.description: Language code of the user's preferred language

password.description: The user's password. It is used to protecty from accidential or malicious account hi-jacking.

newEmailAddressAndUsername.description: The user's new email address. It lill also replace the old username.

displayName.description: Name used e.g. as email display name, null if not changed

language.description: Preferred language, null if not changed.

child.description: True if user is a child.

profileType.description: Application defined value. Can be used e.g. to carry mapping to parental rating configuration, null if not changed

additionalProperties.description: Application defined map String->String. Can be used for arbitrary application specific data, null if not changed

metadata.description: Application defined map String->String. Can be used for arbitrary application specific data, null if not changed

emailAddress.description: The user's email address. Will also be used as username.

language.description: Preferred language. If not set fall back to business unit's default language. iso 639-1 language code.

informationCollectionConsentGivenNow.description: If true consent to information collection is given now. If false or null no consent given now.

password.description: The user's password. Must follow the system's configured policy.

unConfirmed.description: If true the user need to confirm creation bu following email instructions. If false the account is good to go

informationCollectionConsentGivenNow.description: true if consent to collect personal information is given. null == false

expiration.description: When should the session expire. If omitted system default is applied.

sessionUser.description: To be true in very special cases and then you will now.

informationCollectionConsentGivenNow.description: true if consent to collect personal information is given. null == false

code.description: code from the Authorization Code flow

language.description: The user's preferred language. Only used at first login when creating the user.

code_verifier.description: challenge used in the Authorization Code with PKCE flow

redirect_uri.description: a valid redirect URI configured on the OP

language.description: The user's preferred language. Only used at first login when creating the user.
The user's preferred language. Only used at first login when creating the user.

email.description: The user's email address, if provided it may be used. The email could also be taken from he access token.

displayName.description: The user's display name, if provided it may be used. The name could also be taken from he access token's name field.

expiration.description: When should the session expire. If omitted system default is applied.

language.description: The user's preferred language. Only used at first login when creating the user.

accountId.description: Will be used as accountId and, if userId is not provided, as userId.

userId.description: Optional userId, if not provided accountId will be used also as userId.

sessionToken.description: The session (bearer) token to use for subsequent requests.

expirationDateTime.description: The time when the session expires.

deviceId.description: A unique ID of the device.

sessionToken.description: The (bearer) session token to use in subsequent requests.

expirationDateTime.description: The ISO 8601 time when the session expires.

mediaToken.description: The Adobe Primetime AuthZ media token.

language.description: The user's preferred language. Only used at first login when creating the user.

deviceCreated.description: When the device was first created.

currentDevice.description: True if this device is teh device used to list this device..

aboveDeviceLimit.description: If true to many devices are logged in and this session can not be used to play. Normally this will not happen.

crmToken.description: The token of the underlying CRM to use if talking directly to the CRM.

overTheDeviceLimit.description: If true to many devices are logged in and this session can not be used to play. Normally this will not happen.

countryCode.description: ISO country code or null if unknown.

signupMinimumAge.description: Minimum age in years of user signing up to the service

analyticsBaseUrl.description: If stated this is the base URL for analytics events, if not stated the base URL for Exposure API is to be used

analyticsPercentage.description: Probability in percentage that the player shall send analytics events

vapidKey.description: VAPID key used for web app

minimumLength.description: Minimum number of characters in passwords

minimumGroups.description: Minimum number character groups used, eg. alfa, ALFA, 0..9, separators

enabled.description: If Sentry is to be enabled

sampleRate.description: How much reporting to do. 0.0 - 1.0.  0.0 report nothing, 0.5 means report every second session etc.

last4.description: Last of digits of card number

origin.description: Origin of the card E.g. Google Pay, Apple Pay. If empty, consider the origin to be the payment provider

id.description: The id of the payment method

clientSecret.description: If setupCard == false the clientSecret is paymentIntent clientSecret. If setupCard == true the clientSecret is setupIntent clientSecret

setupCard.description: If true setup card else payment

voucherCode.description: Voucher code that should be applied to the purchase

assetId.description:
Single asset id that the purchase will entitle.
Requires that the product offering requires "direct asset purchases"

storePaymentMethod.description:
Store payment method for future usage.
The details is stored within the used payment provider.

ApiStripePurchaseRequest.description:
Purchase using Stripe as payment platform.
Creates an stripe intent.
Requires that Stripe is configured for the customer/business unit.

productOfferingId.description: id of the product offering to get methods and price for.

amount.description: The amount in minor units of the currency. e.g. 10 EUR is 1000, while 100 JPY is 100

fractionDigits.description: Number of fraction digits of the currency as specified by ISO 4217, e.g. for EUR 2 and for JPY 0

ApiStripePaymentMethodTypeAndPrice.description: One entry for each relevant payment method type, such as "card", "ideal"

methodTypes.description: One entry for each relevant payment method type, such as "card", "ideal"

wallets.description: One entry for each relevant wallet, such as "apple", "google"

name.description: Name of wallet e.g apple or google

ApiStripeWalletAndPrice.description: One entry for each relevant wallet, such as "apple", "google"

entitlementStart.description: If present the time at which entitlement starts, if not present entitlement starts ar time of purchase, ISO 8601 Date and time

productRequiresSelectAsset.description: if true, purchase of single asset. The assetId must be provided in the purchase

productOfferingType.description: Type of offering: purchase, rental, event, subscription

paymentMethodTypes.description: If present, this is a list of stripe payment method types that are allowed with this offering

items.description: If present, this is a list of stripe payment method types that are allowed with this offering

sortKey.description: Sorting key to order the offerings by

ApiStoreProductOfferingDiscount.description: The one-time discounted price on a product offering

countryCode.description:
In which country this offering is valid, if not present anywhere
Format: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2, if not present the offering is available globally

percentage.description: The percentage of the price to paid a VAT, e.g. 12.5

included.description: If the VAT is part of the product offering price

startedAt.description: Time of purchase. ISO 8601 Date and time.

from.description: Start of entitlement. ISO 8601 Date and time.

until.description: End of entitlement. ISO 8601 Date and time.

renewAt.description: If present, next time for renewal. ISO 8601 Date and time.

productOfferingId.description: Id of the purchased product offering.

activated.description: Indicates that the user has started to watch the content.

productOfferingType.description: Type of offering: purchase, rental, event, subscription

bearer-key.description: Get a sessionToken with any of the [Authentication](#/Authentication) endpoints.
